ezdb.leveldb
Class EzLevelDb

java.lang.Object
  ezdb.leveldb.EzLevelDb
All Implemented Interfaces:
Db
public class EzLevelDb
extends Object
implements Db

An implementation of Db that uses LevelDb tables to persist data. Each "table" is just a LevelDB database persisted as a subdirectory inside of EzLevelDb's root.

Author:
criccomini

public void deleteTable(String tableName)

Delete a table from disk and memory.

Specified by:
deleteTable in interface Db

getTable

public <H,V> Table<H,V> getTable(String tableName,
                                 Serde<H> hashKeySerde,
                                 Serde<V> valueSerde)
Description copied from interface: Db
Get a simple key/value table with the specified name and serdes. If the table does not exist, it should be created. If the table exists, it should be returned. If the table exists but the serdes don't match the pre-existing table, a runtime exception should occur when the table is used to read or write data.

Specified by:
getTable in interface Db
Parameters:
tableName - The name of the table. The table should be formatted to be compatible with filenames on the host operating system.
hashKeySerde - The hash key serializer.
valueSerde - The value serializer.
Returns:
A simple key/value table.

getTable

public <H,R,V> RangeTable<H,R,V> getTable(String tableName,
                                          Serde<H> hashKeySerde,
                                          Serde<R> rangeKeySerde,
                                          Serde<V> valueSerde)
Description copied from interface: Db
Get a hash/range table with the specified name and serdes. If the table does not exist, it should be created. If the table exists, it should be returned. If the table exists but the serdes don't match the pre-existing table, a runtime exception should occur when the table is used to read or write data.

Specified by:
getTable in interface Db
Parameters:
tableName - The name of the table. The table should be formatted to be compatible with filenames on the host operating system.
hashKeySerde - The hash key serializer.
rangeKeySerde - The range key serializer. If range keys are not used, any serializer can be supplied, as it will be ignored.
valueSerde - The value serializer.
Returns:
A hash/range table.

getTable

public <H,R,V> RangeTable<H,R,V> getTable(String tableName,
                                          Serde<H> hashKeySerde,
                                          Serde<R> rangeKeySerde,
                                          Serde<V> valueSerde,
                                          Comparator<byte[]> hashKeyComparator,
                                          Comparator<byte[]> rangeKeyComparator)
Description copied from interface: Db
Get a hash/range table with the specified name and serdes. If the table does not exist, it should be created. If the table exists, it should be returned. If the table exists but the serdes don't match the pre-existing table, a runtime exception should occur when the table is used to read or write data.

Specified by:
getTable in interface Db
Parameters:
tableName - The name of the table. The table should be formatted to be compatible with filenames on the host operating system.
hashKeySerde - The hash key serializer.
rangeKeySerde - The range key serializer. If range keys are not used, any serializer can be supplied, as it will be ignored.
valueSerde - The value serializer.
hashKeyComparator - A comparator to be used when sorting hash keys.
rangeKeyComparator - A comparator to be used when sorting range keys that have the same hash key.
Returns:
A hash/range table.
